thread.title: Griffin to replace sacked Cleary at Penrith
thread.title_full: Griffin to replace sacked Cleary at Penrith

title: Griffin to replace sacked Cleary at Penrith
text:
Anthony Griffin to replace sacked coach Ivan Cleary at Panthers Phil Rothfield The Daily Telegraph Anthony Griffin to replace sacked coach Ivan Cleary at Panthers Phil Rothfield The Daily Telegraph The Panthers have sacked coach Ivan Cleary. 
THE Penrith Panthers have signed former Broncos coach Anthony Griffin to replace the sacked Ivan Cleary. 
Panthers General Manager Phil Gould has been negotiating with Griffin behind the scenes for several weeks and is expected to make an announcement on Wednesday. 
Griffin was sacked by the Broncos in 2015 but is credited with leaving the club in great shape for Wayne Bennett to take the team to this year’s grand final. 
The Daily Telegraph understands the relationship between Cleary and Gould started to deteriorate over the dumping of Trent Barrett as assistant coach. 
In a statement released on the club’s website, Gould “informed (Cleary) the club has terminated the final year of his contract, effective immediately”. 
“Ivan Cleary has done a tremendous job in his four years at the Panthers,” Gould said. Other Stories
